content: g single_crochet into two stitches right of marker a single_crochet across to one stitch past marker b slip st into next st chain 1 see picture h *turn single_crochet into next five stitches chain 1 * repeat for next 37 row or until handle measures 10 you will now attach the handle to the other side of the bag chain 1 turn single_crochet through the first single_crochet on the handle and through the double_crochet stitch two stitches to the left of the handle marker see picture i single_crochet through the next four stitches on the handle and edge of bag do a slip_stitch at the corner to tack down the handle and single_crochet up one side of the handle see picture j when you get to the other side slip_stitch to tack down the handle and slip across the stitches at the base of the handle see picture k slip_stitch to tack down the handle and single_crochet up the other side of the handle slip st through the stitches where the handle was attached single_crochet across the other edge of the bag until one stitch past the marker slip_stitch through the next double_crochet chain 1 *turn single_crochet into next five stitches chain 1 * repeat for next 37 row or until handle measures same as first attach and do single_crochet edging as with first handle weave in the one end all rights reserved © rebecca compton
